intro: Manettia stenocalyx, commonly known as the narrow-leaved manettia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias, and is characterized by its opposite, elliptical leaves. The plant produces small, clustered white or pale yellow flowers that are often fragrant. Its fruits are small, fleshy berries that turn red when mature. Manettia stenocalyx is typically found in humid, shaded environments such as forest understories.
